name: ListAuditRecords
description:
Retrieve the latest audit trail records from Pagerduty.

This tool fetches audit trail records from Pagerduty, sorted by execution time from newest to oldest. It requires admin, account owner, or global API token access on accounts with the "Audit Trail" feature. Use this tool to monitor recent activities by querying these audit records.

parameters.name: versioning_accept_header
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API you wish to use with the `Accept` header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specifies the media type of the request, use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of audit records to return in a single request.

value_schema.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

parameters.name: next_cursor_token
parameters.description: Token to request the next set of results in a paginated query. Usually from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.

value_schema.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for searching audit records. Defaults to now() - 24 hours if not specified.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now() - 24 hours` (past 24 hours)

parameters.name: date_range_end
parameters.description: The end date for the audit record search. Defaults to now if not provided, and must be within 31 days after the `since` date.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now()`. May not be more than 31 days after `since`.

parameters.name: filter_by_resource_type
parameters.description: Filter audit records by the specified types of resources, such as users, teams, or services.

value_schema.description: Resource type filter for the root_resource.

parameters.name: actor_type_filter
parameters.description: Specifies the type of actor to filter records by. Options are 'user_reference', 'api_key_reference', or 'app_reference'.

value_schema.description: Actor type filter.

parameters.name: filter_by_actor_id
parameters.description: Filter audit records by a specific Actor ID. Requires 'actor_type' to be specified.

value_schema.description: Actor Id filter. Must be qualified by providing the `actor_type` param.

parameters.name: filter_by_method_type
parameters.description: Filter records by method type. Options are 'browser', 'oauth', 'api_token', 'identity_provider', or 'other'.

value_schema.description: Method type filter.

parameters.name: method_truncated_token_filter
parameters.description: Filter records by a specific method truncated token. Requires 'method_type' to be provided.

value_schema.description: Method truncated_token filter. Must be qualified by providing the `method_type` param.

parameters.name: action_filter
parameters.description: Filter audit records by specified action types: 'create', 'update', or 'delete'.

value_schema.description: Action filter

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

value_schema.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

parameters.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

value_schema.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now() - 24 hours` (past 24 hours)

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now() - 24 hours` (past 24 hours)

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now()`. May not be more than 31 days after `since`.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now()`. May not be more than 31 days after `since`.
